body:
We should create subclasses of `PerlPackage` for common Perl build systems.

### Rationale

The current `PerlPackage` is rather complex and difficult to extend. It would be better structured with subclasses.

### Description

Here are some common Perl build systems I've found:

| Build Tool | Filename |
| --- | --- |
| [`Module::Build`](https://metacpan.org/pod/Module::Build) | `Build.PL` |
| [`Module::Install`](https://metacpan.org/pod/Module::Install) | `Makefile.PL` |
| [`ExtUtils::MakeMaker`](https://metacpan.org/pod/ExtUtils::MakeMaker) | `Makefile.PL` |
| [`Dist::Zilla`](https://metacpan.org/pod/Dist::Zilla) | `Dist.Ini` |

### Additional information

http://preaction.me/talks/Perl/Compare-Building-Modules.html

We may want to consider something similar for `PythonPackage` since there are multiple Python build systems (Distutils, Setuptools, Poetry, etc.)
title: Split PerlPackage into multiple build systems
